Format is compatible with McStas/PGPLOT wavelength monitor files. When specified, temperature and intensity values are ignored.

parameter_comments.radius: Outer radius of sample in (x,z) plane
parameter_comments.xwidth: Width of crystal
parameter_comments.geometry: Name of an Object File Format (OFF) or PLY file for complex geometry. The OFF/PLY file may be generated from XYZ coordinates using qhull/powercrust
parameter_comments.mosaic: Crystal mosaic (isotropic), gaussian RMS. Puts the crystal in the isotropic mosaic model state, thus disregarding other mosaicity parameters.
parameter_comments.mosaic_a: Horizontal (rotation around lattice vector a) mosaic (anisotropic), gaussian RMS. Put the crystal in the anisotropic crystal vector state. I.e. model mosaicity through rotation around the crystal lattice vectors. Has precedence over in-plane mosaic model.
parameter_comments.mosaic_b: Vertical (rotation around lattice vector b) mosaic (anisotropic), gaussian RMS.
parameter_comments.mosaic_c: Out-of-plane (Rotation around lattice vector c) mosaic (anisotropic), gaussian RMS
parameter_comments.mosaic_AB: In Plane mosaic rotation and plane vectors (anisotropic), mosaic_A, mosaic_B, A_h,A_k,A_l, B_h,B_k,B_l. Puts the crystal in the in-plane mosaic state. Vectors A and B define plane in which  the crystal roation is defined, and mosaic_A, mosaic_B, denotes the resp. mosaicities (gaussian RMS) with respect to the two reflections chosen by A and B (Miller indices).
parameter_comments.recip_cell: Choice of direct/reciprocal (0/1) unit cell definition
parameter_comments.ax: Coordinates of first (direct/recip) unit cell vector
parameter_comments.bx: Coordinates of second (direct/recip) unit cell vector
parameter_comments.cx: Coordinates of third (direct/recip) unit cell vector
parameter_comments.reflections: File name containing structure factors of reflections (LAZ LAU CIF, FullProf, ShelX). Use empty ("") or NULL for incoherent scattering only
parameter_comments.order: Limit multiple scattering up to given order (0
parameter_comments.extra_order: When using order, allow additional multiple scattering without coherent scattering, sensible with very large unit cells (0
parameter_comments.p_transmit: Monte Carlo probability for neutrons to be transmitted without any scattering. Used to improve statistics from weak reflections
parameter_comments.sigma_abs: Absorption cross-section per unit cell at 2200 m/s
parameter_comments.sigma_inc: Incoherent scattering cross-section per unit cell Use -1 to inactivate
parameter_comments.aa: Unit cell angles alpha, beta and gamma. Then uses norms of vectors a,b and c as lattice parameters
parameter_comments.barns: Flag to indicate if |F|^2 from 'reflections' is in barns or fm^2. barns=1 for laz and isotropic constant elastic scattering (reflections=NULL), barns=0 for lau type files
parameter_comments.RX: Radius of horizontal along X lattice curvature. flat for 0
parameter_comments.RY: Radius of vertical along Y lattice curvature. flat for 0
parameter_comments.powder: Flag to indicate powder mode, for simulation of Debye-Scherrer cones via random crystallite orientation. A powder texture can be approximated with 0<powder<1
parameter_comments.PG: Flag to indicate "Pyrolytic Graphite" mode, only meaningful with choice of Graphite.lau, models PG crystal. A powder texture can be approximated with 0<PG<1 with main axis on 'c'
parameter_comments.deltak: Equality-threshold for use in SPLIT settings. If difference between all ki_{x,y,z} are less than deltak from previous particle, the two are considered alike enough to jump directly to the MC choice between 'active' reflections

parameter_comments.xwidth: Width of sample volume
parameter_comments.phi: Volume-ratio of the spheres wrt. solution
parameter_comments.dsdw_inc: The incoherent background from the overall sample, should read ca. 1.0 for water, 0.5 for half D2O, half H2O, and ca. 0.02 for D2O
parameter_comments.sc_aim: The fraction of neutron paths used to represent the scattered neutrons (including everything
parameter_comments.sans_aim: The fraction of neutron paths used to represent the scattered neutrons in the sans-range (up to 1.0AA-1). rest is incoherent with Q>1AA-1.
parameter_comments.singlesp: Switches between multiple scattering (parameter zero 0.0) and single scattering (parameter 1.0). The sc_aim directs a fraction of paths to the first scattering process accordingly. The no. of paths for the second scattering process is derived from the real probability. Up to 10 scattering processes are considered.

parameter_comments.model_pars: Model parameters are given as a set of comma-separated values enclosed by {}, e.g. {60} for the model index 21 (the guinier model). Consult the sasview docs for further info.

parameter_comments.d_phi: scattering vertical angular spreading (usually the height of the next component/detector). Use 0 for full space. This is only relevant for single scattering (order=1).
parameter_comments.threshold: Value under which S(Q,w) is not accounted for. to set according to the S(Q,w) values, i.e. not too low.
parameter_comments.p_interact: Force a given fraction of the beam to scatter, keeping intensity right, to enhance small signals (-1 inactivate).
parameter_comments.norm: Normalize S(q,w) when -1 (default). Use raw data when 1, multiplier for S(q,w) when norm>0.
parameter_comments.classical: Assumes the S(q,w) data from the files is a classical S(q,w), and multiply that data by exp(hw/2kT) on up/down energy sides. Use 0 when obtained from raw experiments, 1 from molecular dynamics. Use -1 to guess from a data set including both energy sides.
parameter_comments.quantum_correction: Specify the type of quantum correction to use "Boltzmann"/"Schofield","harmonic"/"Bader" or "standard"/"Frommhold" (default)
parameter_comments.powder_Dd: global Delta_d/d spreading, or 0 if ideal.
parameter_comments.powder_DW: global Debey-Waller factor, if not in |F2| or 1.
parameter_comments.powder_format: name or definition of column indexes in file
parameter_comments.powder_barns: 0 when |F2| data in powder file are fm^2, 1 when in barns (barns=1 for laz, barns=0 for lau type files).
parameter_comments.VarSqw: internal structure including  dq=wavevector transfer Kf-Ki in Angs-1; dw=energy transfer Ef-Ei in meV; type=interaction type of event as 'c' (coherent),  't' (transmitted) 'i' (incoherent) 'v' (isotropic incoherent, Vanadium-like).

parameter_comments.mosaic: Crystal mosaic (isotropic), gaussian RMS. Puts the crystal in the isotropic mosaic model state, thus disregarding other mosaicity parameters.
parameter_comments.mosaic_a: Horizontal (rotation around lattice vector a) mosaic (anisotropic), gaussian RMS. Put the crystal in the anisotropic crystal vector state. I.e. model mosaicity through rotation around the crystal lattice vectors. Has precedence over in-plane mosaic model.
parameter_comments.mosaic_b: Vertical (rotation around lattice vector b) mosaic (anisotropic), gaussian RMS.
parameter_comments.mosaic_c: Out-of-plane (Rotation around lattice vector c) mosaic (anisotropic), gaussian RMS
parameter_comments.mosaic_AB: In Plane mosaic rotation and plane vectors (anisotropic), mosaic_A, mosaic_B, A_h,A_k,A_l, B_h,B_k,B_l. Puts the crystal in the in-plane mosaic state. Vectors A and B define plane in which  the crystal roation is defined, and mosaic_A, mosaic_B, denotes the resp. mosaicities (gaussian RMS) with respect to the two reflections chosen by A and B (Miller indices).
